name: citizenM Paris Charles de Gaulle
detail: I really like CitizenM and when I have a layover that's usually where I stay. But I've never had a layover on CDG before and it took me forever to find out how to get the CSGVAL. I arrived late in the evening and during corona, so the airport was a mess. Would have been great to have a little map or something from the hotel telling me how to get out there ðŸ˜Š
area: Paris Charles de Gaulle Airport,Paris - View on map

name: Hotel France Louvre
detail: Location was excellent for a long holiday weekend in Paris with 300m from the metro and close to many main attractions. Small supermarket and many restaurants in the neighbourhood; an excellent cafÃ©-boulangerie for breakfast just one minute's walk away. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Room was ok, oldish but clean, comfortable beds, however our clothes got an odd smell from the wardrobe. Hotels in Paris are indeed very expensive, and you pay for the location and not for the standard.

name: Hotel De France Invalides
detail: We spent 3 nights in a tiny room in this hotel (although most rooms in 2 and 3-star hotels in Paris are on the rather small side). To our delight, we had a small balcony with a side view of the beautiful dome of Les Invalides. Although the hotel does not appear to be very modern, it thankfully has an elevator and the rooms have flat-screen tvs. Whenever you leave the hotel, the key must be surrendered at the reception. Location-wise, the nearest metro (Ecole Militaire) is only a few minutes away by foot and many good cafÃ©s and bistros dot the area. We appreciated the free wifi, the kind staff and the breakfast consisting of toast, different spreads, yoghurt, fruit, cheeses, cold cuts, and eggs, but the eggs had to be prepared yourself, either boiled or fried in the pan provided.
area: 7th - Tour Eiffel - Invalides,Paris - View on map

name: St Christopher's Inn Paris - Gare du Nord
detail: I arrived at Gare du Nord train station, Paris from the CDG airport (easy - phew!) and found that St Christopher's Inn was easy to find once you navigated yourself out of the station and found your bearings on Rue de Dunkurque (walk towards the post office). Although I arrived early they were very friendly and offered me a shower to freshen up and (paid) lockers to hold my stuff until 2pm check in. If you forget anything like a towel (whoops!), you can rent one for the length of your stay as well as buy other basic essentials. I found the staff very informative, spoke English well and tried their best to accommodate my every need. The room (6 mixed dorm) and bed linen were really clean (amazing doona!), warm and secure. You also got a massive drawer to lock your stuff in under your bunk. The showers were good but the cleaning agent/or disinfectant in the showers/communal bathroom was pretty stinky?! I also found it difficult to keep pressing the shower button whilst having a shower due to a neurological disorder in my arm but I managed. They were of a decent size so you could get changed in the cubicle without getting your clothes wet. The food at night was good (I'm a vegetarian - burger pattie was really dry) but not fantastic. The continental breakfast was on the other hand great and good quality! Baguettes, cheese, cereal, coffee, juice, etc. nice. I also used the laundry facilities up stairs (about 5 Euro wash and dry), which was good. Overall my stay there was great and will stay there again en route back to Oz. Can't really fault anything of locker, towel rent and laundry costs as well as stinky bathrooms but otherwise the location is pretty darn awesome! Thanks guys and gals. Looking forward to seeing you all again!! Oh and the free day tour with Roberta through Paris is so worth it!! Just rug up and don't drink too much coffee beforehand (no toilets!! ha!).
area: 10th - Gare du Nord,Paris - View on map

name: Metropol Hotel
detail: The hotel is very close to Gare du Nord railway station. You can take a train (RER) straight from CDG airport about 10 stations to Gare du Nord and it cost 10.30 euro and then walk from there around 5-6 minutes to the hotel. There is the hop on hop off bus stop at the Gare du Nord railway station (red line) for your first time in Paris, you can easily access to Paris city. The hotel is nice, staff very helpful. Iâ€™m satisfied during my staying in Paris. I would recommend this hotel.
area: 10th - Gare du Nord,Paris - View on map
